{{cpp/title|tuple_size{{small|&lt;std::pair&gt;}}}}
{{cpp/utility/pair/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=utility|since=c++11|
template&lt; class T1, class T2 &gt;
struct tuple_size&lt;std::pair&lt;T1, T2&gt;&gt;
    : std::integral_constant&lt;std::size_t, 2&gt; { };
}}

The partial specialization of {{c|std::tuple_size}} for pairs provides a compile-time way to obtain the number of elements in a pair, which is always 2, using tuple-like syntax.

{{cpp/types/integral_constant/inherit2|the constant value 2|std::size_t}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;tuple&gt;
#include &lt;utility&gt;

template&lt;class T&gt;
void test([[maybe_unused]]T t)
{
    [[maybe_unused]]
    int a[std::tuple_size&lt;T&gt;::value]; // can be used at compile time
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::tuple_size&lt;T&gt;::value &lt;&lt; '\n'; // or at run time
}

int main()
{
    test(std::make_tuple(1, 2, 3.14));
    test(std::make_pair(1, 3.14));
}
|output=
3
2
}}
